actioncomponent.title: ActionComponent
actioncomponent.description: Interactive element that triggers actions (button, menu, link, voice command)

type.description: Interactive element kind, per HTML 5.3 button, anchor, and menu element semantics.

channel.description: Delivery channel for which this component is rendered.

style.description: Visual style variant of the action component, per design system button style conventions.

validations.description: Client-side validation rules applied to this component, per HTML 5.3 Constraint Validation API. Each rule specifies a constraint type, threshold value, and user-facing error message.

type.description: Constraint type. 'required': field must not be empty; 'minlength'/'maxlength': string length bounds (value = integer); 'pattern': regex the input must match (value = regex string); 'min'/'max': numeric range (value = number); 'type': expected data type; 'custom': application-defined rule.

value.description: Constraint threshold or parameter (e.g., '8' for minlength, '^[a-z]+$' for pattern).

message.description: User-facing error message shown when this constraint is violated.

actionpattern.title: ActionPattern
actionpattern.description: Reusable action configuration for common user interactions. Defines the trigger, feedback mechanism, and optional target for recurring UX patterns. Example: 'confirm-and-delete' pattern — trigger: click on delete button, feedback: confirmation modal then success toast, targetRef: the item being deleted.

category.description: Functional taxonomy of the action pattern.

trigger.description: Input modality that initiates this action pattern.

feedback.description: User-facing feedback mechanism invoked after the action completes.

targetRef.description: Optional specNodeId of the component or element this action pattern is applied to.

chartseries.title: ChartSeries
chartseries.description: Configuration for a data series within a chart component, specifying data source, visualization type, colors, and legend properties. Defines how data is visualized in charts.

type.description: Visualization type for this data series.

dataField.description: Field name from the bound data source representing the numeric/value axis of this series (e.g., 'revenue', 'count'). For formal data-model binding, use a relationship to the corresponding data-model entity.

categoryField.description: Field name from the bound data source representing the category/x-axis grouping (e.g., 'month', 'region'). For formal data-model binding, use a relationship to the corresponding data-model entity.

color.description: CSS color value for this series (e.g., '#3B82F6', 'var(--brand-primary)'). Overrides any theme-level color scheme for this specific series.

lineStyle.description: CSS border/line style applied to line chart series rendering, per CSS Border specification.

componentinstance.title: ComponentInstance
componentinstance.description: Instance of a LibraryComponent with application-specific configuration

order.description: Render order of this component instance within its parent View or SubView's component list. Lower values render first.

ref.description: SpecNodeId of the ux.librarycomponent this instance is based on (e.g., 'ux.librarycomponent.data-table'). Determines the component type and the set of valid prop keys.

props.description: Key-value map of property overrides applied to this instance. Keys must match prop names declared on the referenced LibraryComponent. Values override the component defaults for this specific usage.

componentreference.title: ComponentReference
componentreference.description: A declarative placeholder in a parent component's named slot, pointing to another component to be rendered there. Unlike ComponentInstance (a concrete rendered occurrence), ComponentReference is a composition declaration that says 'render this component in this slot of the parent', analogous to the HTML slot element.

ref.description: SpecNodeId of the component (ux.librarycomponent or ux.componentinstance) to render in the slot.

variant.description: Optional design variant override for this reference (e.g., 'compact', 'expanded', 'readonly'). Must match a variant defined on the referenced component.

slot.description: Named slot in the parent component where this reference is placed. Slot names are defined by the parent LibraryComponent (e.g., 'header', 'actions', 'footer').

dataconfig.title: DataConfig
dataconfig.description: Configuration for data binding and state management within UI components, defining data sources, transformation pipelines, and update triggers. Manages component data flow.

source.description: Data origin for this binding configuration.

target.description: SpecNodeId of the destination element receiving bound data (e.g., a data-model entity ID or API endpoint ID). Use relationships to formally link to those layers.

path.description: Dot-notation or JSONPath expression selecting a field within the source data (e.g., 'user.profile.name' or '$.items[0].id').

errorconfig.title: ErrorConfig
errorconfig.description: Configuration for error handling and display within UI components, specifying error message formats, retry behavior, fallback content, and user guidance. Ensures consistent error UX.

notificationType.description: Severity category of the notification, aligned with ARIA live region and alert role semantics.

experiencestate.title: ExperienceState
experiencestate.description: Distinct state that the experience can be in (works across all channels)

initial.description: When true, marks this as the starting state of the state machine. Only one ExperienceState per state machine should have initial: true.

channel.description: Delivery channel context for this experience state.

onEnter.description: List of StateAction specNodeIds executed when entering this state (lifecycle: on-enter).

onExit.description: List of StateAction specNodeIds executed when leaving this state (lifecycle: on-exit).

transitions.description: List of StateTransition specNodeIds owned by this state, defining the outgoing edges of the state machine.

enabledComponents.description: List of component specNodeIds that are interactive (enabled) when this state is active. Corresponds to ARIA aria-disabled=false.

disabledComponents.description: List of component specNodeIds that are non-interactive (disabled) when this state is active. Corresponds to ARIA aria-disabled=true.

hiddenComponents.description: List of component specNodeIds that are not rendered when this state is active. Corresponds to ARIA aria-hidden=true or display:none.

layoutconfig.title: LayoutConfig
layoutconfig.description: Configuration for UI layout structure, defining grid systems, responsive breakpoints, spacing rules, and component arrangement patterns. Controls visual organization of the interface.

type.description: CSS layout mode governing element positioning and flow, per CSS Flexbox/Grid specification.

alignContent.description: CSS align-content property value, per CSS Flexbox/Grid specification.

alignItems.description: CSS align-items property value, per CSS Flexbox/Grid specification.

justifyContent.description: CSS justify-content property value, per CSS Flexbox/Grid specification.

justifyItems.description: CSS justify-items property value, per CSS Grid specification.

stickyPosition.description: Anchor edge for CSS position:sticky elements, per CSS Positioning specification.

style.description: Visual presentation style applied to the layout container.

labelPosition.description: Placement of form field labels relative to their input elements, per HTML 5.3 label element positioning patterns.

librarycomponent.title: LibraryComponent
librarycomponent.description: Reusable UI component definition that can be instantiated in multiple UXSpecs

type.description: UI component category used for library organization and component lookup.

category.description: Fine-grained categorization within the component type (e.g., 'data-grid', 'inline-form', 'bar-chart') for library browsing and search.

source.description: Distribution source for this component (npm package, git repository, or internal registry).

identifier.description: Package name, git URL, or registry path (e.g., '@org/ui-components', 'https://github.com/org/ui').

props.description: Schema of properties accepted by this component. Each entry defines an accepted prop with its name, type, and whether it is required.

type.description: Data type of the prop value.

required.description: Whether this prop must be provided by consumers.

default.description: Default value as string; coerced to declared type at runtime.

slots.description: Named content slots this component exposes for composition, analogous to HTML slot elements in Web Components.

description.description: What content is expected in this slot.

events.description: Custom events emitted by this component that consumers can listen to.

description.description: When this event fires and what payload it carries.

librarysubview.title: LibrarySubView
librarysubview.description: Reusable, non-routable grouping of components intended to be composed into Views or other SubViews. Unlike View, LibrarySubView has no route and cannot be navigated to directly. It exists purely as a reusable composition unit, analogous to an HTML template element.

category.description: Functional category grouping related sub-views within a library (e.g., 'forms', 'data-display', 'navigation', 'feedback').

components.description: Ordered list of ComponentInstance specNodeIds that constitute this reusable sub-view composition.

stateaction.title: StateAction
stateaction.description: A concrete action bound to a specific ExperienceState lifecycle event. Instances are bound to a state and lifecycle hook; for reusable parameterizable definitions use StateActionTemplate. Examples: scroll-to-top (lifecycle: on-enter), focus-first-field (lifecycle: on-enter), dispatch-analytics-event (lifecycle: on-exit).

action.description: Operation executed during the state lifecycle.

lifecycle.description: State lifecycle hook that triggers this action. 'on-enter': fires when entering the owning ExperienceState; 'on-exit': fires when leaving it; 'on-transition': fires during any outgoing transition from this state.

timing.description: Execution scheduling within the lifecycle hook: 'immediate' runs synchronously before the state activates; 'deferred' runs asynchronously after; 'conditional' runs only when a guard condition is met.

stateactiontemplate.title: StateActionTemplate
stateactiontemplate.description: A parameterizable, reusable definition of an action to execute during state transitions. StateActionTemplate is the definition; StateAction is the concrete usage bound to a specific ExperienceState and lifecycle hook. Example: a 'scroll-to-top' template with a 'targetId' parameter, instantiated as a StateAction on multiple states.

action.description: Operation this template encapsulates. Must match a value from the StateAction action enum.

parameters.description: Configurable parameters that can be supplied when instantiating this template as a StateAction. Each item defines a named input with its expected type and optional default value.

name.description: Parameter identifier used to reference it in the action (e.g., 'targetId', 'routePath').

type.description: Expected data type of the parameter value.

default.description: Optional default value as a string; coerced to the declared type at runtime.

statepattern.title: StatePattern
statepattern.description: Reusable state machine template for common UX interaction flows, composed of named ExperienceStates and transitions. Canonical examples: 'wizard' — multi-step form with back/next/submit transitions; 'optimistic-update' — loading → success/error with retry; 'tab-panel' — N peer states with tab-driven transitions; 'authenticated-route' — unauthenticated → redirect/login → authenticated.

category.description: Functional taxonomy of the reusable state machine pattern.

states.description: Ordered list of ExperienceState specNodeIds comprising this reusable pattern. The first entry is the initial state.

items.description: specNodeId of an ExperienceState node belonging to this pattern.

statetransition.title: StateTransition
statetransition.description: A directed edge in the ExperienceState machine, owned by its source ExperienceState. Specifies the trigger event, destination state, optional guard condition, and side-effect actions. The 'from' state is implicitly the ExperienceState that contains this transition via relationship.

to.description: SpecNodeId of the destination ExperienceState this transition leads to (e.g., 'ux.experiencestate.order-confirmed').

trigger.description: DOM or UX event that initiates this state transition, per HTML 5.3 event model.

actions.description: List of StateAction specNodeIds to execute when this transition fires, in order.

guard.description: Optional boolean guard condition that must evaluate to true for this transition to fire.

expression.description: Boolean expression string evaluated against current state context.

syntax.description: Expression language used to evaluate the guard expression. 'javascript': JS boolean expression (e.g., 'user.isLoggedIn && cart.items.length > 0'); 'jsonpath': JSONPath predicate (e.g., '$.user.role == "admin"'); 'cel': Common Expression Language (e.g., 'user.age >= 18'); 'jsonata': JSONata expression (e.g., '$count(items) > 0').

subview.title: SubView
subview.description: A non-routable UI fragment embedded within a parent View. Two usage modes: (1) Library instance — 'ref' is populated with a ux.librarysubview specNodeId, rendering that reusable fragment; (2) Inline definition — 'ref' is absent and the SubView defines its own composition inline. SubViews are not independently routable; use View for routable pages.

order.description: Render order of this SubView within its parent View's subViews list. Lower values render first (top-to-bottom or left-to-right depending on layout).

ref.description: SpecNodeId of the ux.librarysubview this instance is based on (e.g., 'ux.librarysubview.data-table-with-filters'). When present, this SubView is a library instance; when absent, it is an inline definition.

tablecolumn.title: TableColumn
tablecolumn.description: Configuration for a single column within a data table component, specifying header, data binding, sorting, filtering, and rendering options. Defines table structure and behavior.

filterType.description: Filter operation type available for this column, per HTML 5.3 form input filter patterns.

textAlign.description: CSS text-align value for cell content, per CSS Text specification.

displayType.description: Rendering type that controls how cell values are visually presented.

defaultSortDirection.description: Default sort direction applied to this column when first sorted.

transitiontemplate.title: TransitionTemplate
transitiontemplate.description: Defines reusable animation and transition patterns for state changes, page navigation, or component lifecycle events. Ensures consistent motion design across the application.

animationType.description: Motion animation category applied during this transition.

duration.description: CSS transition duration (e.g., '300ms', '0.5s'), per CSS Transitions specification.

easing.description: CSS timing function controlling the transition's acceleration curve (e.g., 'ease-in-out', 'cubic-bezier(0.4, 0, 0.2, 1)').

uxapplication.title: UXApplication
uxapplication.description: Application-level UX configuration that groups UXSpecs and defines shared settings

channel.description: Primary delivery channel this application targets. Multi-channel products use one UXApplication per channel, each referencing channel-specific UXSpecs.

experiences.description: List of UXSpec specNodeIds that comprise the user experiences of this application.

theme.description: Design token theme identifier applied application-wide (e.g., 'brand-light', 'brand-dark', 'high-contrast').

designSystem.description: Identifier of the design system or UXLibrary this application uses (e.g., specNodeId of a ux.uxlibrary node).

defaultLocale.description: Default locale for internationalization, as a BCP 47 language tag (e.g., 'en-US', 'fr-FR', 'ja-JP').

uxlibrary.title: UXLibrary
uxlibrary.description: Collection of reusable UI components and sub-views that can be shared across applications

components.description: List of ux.librarycomponent specNodeIds exported by this library.

subViews.description: List of ux.librarysubview specNodeIds exported by this library.

statePatterns.description: List of ux.statepattern specNodeIds exported by this library.

actionPatterns.description: List of ux.actionpattern specNodeIds exported by this library.

source.description: Distribution source for this library package.

type.description: Distribution mechanism: 'npm' for a published npm package, 'git' for a git repository URL, 'internal-registry' for a private artifact registry.

identifier.description: Package name, git URL, or registry path (e.g., '@org/design-system', 'https://github.com/org/ds', 'registry.internal/ux-lib').

uxspec.title: UXSpec
uxspec.description: Complete UX specification for a single experience (visual, voice, chat, SMS)

experience.description: Delivery modality this spec describes. 'visual': screen-based UI; 'voice': voice assistant interface; 'chat': conversational messaging UI; 'sms': text message-based interaction.

source.description: Reference to the design artifact (e.g., Figma file, Storybook, or internal design system URL) that this spec is based on.

views.description: List of ux.view specNodeIds that comprise the routable screens of this experience.

states.description: List of ux.experiencestate specNodeIds that represent the top-level states of this experience's state machine.

view.title: View
view.description: Routable grouping of components (a complete user experience)

type.description: View display mode, per HTML 5.3 sectioning and dialog element semantics.
